Floor and Ceiling:
$\lfloor x \rfloor, \lceil x \rceil : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{Z}$

Number Theory
$\frac{b}{a} \in \mathbb{Z} \implies a \mid b$

Theorem
Let $a,b,c \in \mathbb{Z}$, $a \neq 0$
$a \mid b \land a \mid c \implies a \mid (b+c)$
$a \mid b \implies a \mid bc$
$a \mid b \land b \mid c \implies a \mid c$

Suppose $a \mid b, b \mid a$. Then $a = b \lor a = -b$

Division Algorithm
Let $a, (d \gt 0) \in \mathbb{Z}$
Then $\exists! q,r : a = dq + r$ where $0 \leq r \lt d$

$a \mod d$ is the remainder
$a \div d$ is the quotient

$q = \lfloor \frac{a}{d} \rfloor$
No formula for $r$ other than $a - dq = a - d \lfloor \frac{a}{d} \rfloor$

Congruence notation
$a \equiv b \mod m$

Theorem
$a \equiv b \mod m \iff a,b$ leave the same reminder when divided by $m$
That is, $a \mod m = b \mod m$
